column5: Fantastic fish.  You're buddy should be proud of that catch.  Gotta ask though guys.... 24/7 - you and WhiteSpinner are fishing buds, right???  Sometimes I believe you were and now you're not.  I tend to also believe that WSBait has shown you a few great spots over the years and now you're out sharing them with others...???  Is this right?  I don't read everything posted so maybe I just catch the odd tidbit that makes me think this way.  WSB, you sometimes come across as upset by 24/7's good catches from some places???  Is this why?  Doods, no need to answer publically or at all if you don't want.  I was just curious as I seem to recall some other times in other posts when you two were at odds.

Many stocked lakes are really isolated......and sometimes very sizable fish.  I remember a particular little lake (more like a pond) in Algonquin that had a bunch of 3-4 lb specks dumped into it one spring.   Unfortunately it was fished out pretty quickly.

would a stocked trout lake..... with time... be able to reproduce ???   cause if this lake IS stocked....... they seem to be reproducing....   iv been there 3 years now and i never saw no one stocking this lake.   whens the best time to stock a lake???  not in the middle of summer i supose. with the hot water and all.................................  i realy want to know .  any trout biologist other than whitespinnerbait on this forum???

Don't mean to hijack the thread, but I know a similar lake in Algonquin.  Good probability it's the same lake, a tiny lake adjacent to Galeairy Lake. I fished it 18 years ago shortly after they dumped the brood stock in and we caught some monsters. Unfortunately word spread and it was fished out.
no tape...... but unlike you guys we had a scale!   how much did your weight???

I can tell you what I know from my experience.  A few years back I heard rumours of a small lake with huge brookies in the Elk Lake region of northern ontario.  Apparantly it was a lake that the mnr stocked and used to entertain certain privelaged bigwigs. They even built a cabin on the lake to house there guests.  I was told that they'd stopped stocking the lake years ago, tore down the cabin and that there was a remnant population of few but usually large fish.  Of course I had to investigate.  With extreme difficulty I bushwhacked in with camping gear and canoe and the stories turned out to be true. I camped at the site of the old cabin and caught a dozen or so fish between 4 and 6lbs. Had one on that still haunts me to this day, I figure that fish was 8 plus.  Anyhow, most stocked lakes aren't able to sustain populations of fish when stocking has ended. Without upwelling springs they're simply not able to.  Some stocked lakes like the one I fished have a marginal ability to reproduce. Because the reproduction is so limited the few that do hatch and survive usually grow to enormous sizes. They just don't have the competition for food.
Note the stocked fish in Temagami have no fin clips... not that I noticed anyhow.. They seem to be all there..
No clue   no scale on hand    but at least what I know is she's 18" long by 12" girth wise
this makes perfect sense to me....  this lake we are fishing is spring fed...... TONS of minnows may flies....salamander ext....  no wonder...  ITS ALL CLEAR NOW!  thanx

Hey Moose....   One thing you never want to do is witness 24/7 and I out fishing for bass or pike together...........   The name calling between us would bring a grown man to tears...  :wacko:   P.S.   never been at odds , just ribbing each other

Wayne nailed, they fly 'em in. As far as fin clipping goes they do indeed clip the adipose and even partial clips of the dorsal fin (some do get missed in the process). Changing the fin clip each year allows them to identify when it was stocked, thus allowing growth and health info to be gathered.  Specks can under ideal conditions spawn in upwelling springs as long as they can expose clean gravel that doesn't silt over before the eggs hatch. A friend has a cottage on a spring lake where I've wittnessed this many times. The trout will expose clean gravel on the lake bed where springs well up. Mind you these are wild specks and this trait is inherit, stockers may not do well in this type of situation.  As far as splake or brookie? Even to the trained eye it can be difficult. Check these links.  http://www.couplesresort.ca/Attractions/Ar...ish/Splake.html  http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/en/Business/LetsF...age/200080.html  The thing to do would be to contact the local MNR and request stocking information on the lake, they will give it to you.  I will say it again though, they are all magnificent fish.
thanx alot spiel....  never seen any other fins clipped on any other specks we have caught tho...  but ill keep a closer look .
Heading back to the Lake in question , this weekend ...  This time all fish will be released like they should have been in the first place.....

Just read this...  Not sure if my reply was taken the right way..  Not even sure if you speak da french hein?!  I wasn't trying to dispute how the fish was hooked, just hinting to the fact that it must have been quite a triumph to get the thing in..  Awesome brood stock fish!!  LOL
i dought that will happen....  cause im planning on getting another super.  and the next week end after that one another super....  so that makes two specks kept.......sorry

Great fish!  I can't say much about stocking, or fin clips.  All I know is that none of the stocked brook trout up this way have fin clips.   I would imagine, if you really want to find out that you would be able to get a stocking list if you looked hard enough.
Stcoked or not............... Absolute thrill to hook into one of those Magnificent specimens ......

Well its been a long time since ic posted a report..... had to wait for trout openner and the ice to melt !   This is one of the best stories yet......  as we all know .... Jaques ( aka) leechman. got his PB speck yesterday.....Again CONGRATS!  well i was supposed to go with him that day but i called is SICK.........  so i decided to go today.....  well my cousin calls me......... let me call him THE LUCKIEST GUY ON EARTH!  to go fishing ....  Let me refreash all of your memories.. this is the guy i brouth musky fishing and on the first day he caught the FAMOUS 48 ''    RING A BELL?????????????  welllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllll.... we get to the lake .... and we fish this paradice from shore.....  we get half ways around the lake and he yells fish on...... im like OK more like STUCK AGAIN!  there are so many fallen trees in this lake... ask leechman he lost 4 mepps yesterday....    example of beaver infested area!  BACK TO THE STORY NOW!  FISH ON HE SAYS..... i look and hes into the fight of hes life...................  this speck is taking so much drag ITS INSANE!  a Couple of heart stoping moments thru the fight tho..... the speck takes the drag and goes underneth a sunken treee........  then aften it untangled it self free.... it goes around a STUMP!!!!!!!  im like MY OH MY hes going to lose this one......  good thing i hoooked him up with 10 lbs mono !  THIS KID LANDS HER!!!!!  WHAT A SPECK!!!! BEAUTY!!! CONGRATS COUSIN!            insane girth!      had to take lots of pictures of this one...... the trout of a life time!  did i say it was his first time speck fishing?????   4.5 lbs OF PURE HEALTHY NATIVE SPRING FED QUEBEC RED BABY!!!    now you know why i call him lucky.... and he calls me his lucky charm .....  oh yeah BTW................................  i got one too.......        24/7
That's it, you and Leechman aren't allowed to post anymore
Great report and pics Kevin  Congratulations to Ryan for beaching that monster That is the biggest speck I've ever seen  Great job you guys!!! Thanks for sharing Jacques
YOUR TELLING ME??????????????????   btw i lost 3 mepps and 1 small ''o''
Wow great report .. i am so jealous now i could spit. It is heart warming to see the native trout are doing so good

Are you kidding me???? Those 3 fish from the same body of water????? In the last 2 days???? I'm not sure if all the brookies I've caught in my life (and I have caught a lot... of small ones) add up to the weight of these 3.  Nice fishes gentlemen.
Here Here .........   Fish of a Life Time right there...........  :worthy:  :worthy:
Kev, what was the length and girth of this monster??
It's a rare day when you get one like that. WTG
That is one sweeet speck!!  Looks like that lake has all the right stuff..  Veux-tu ben me dire comment y'a fait pour la rentrer?!!  Right on boys.  Congrats to you both!  HD

Very very impressive fish! Have to say you've got the "Izumi hold" down pat though. What's truly impressive is that they're wild fish. Usually it's the small stocked lakes that coughs up specimens like that.
I'm still gunning for a speck of that stature, man they are all beauties!  I did note however that your cousins fish (perhaps all of them) are from stock as seen in the absence of an adipose fin.
Don't worry about them posting anymore , if they catch and keep another trout that size they won't be allowed to fish that Lake '' ANYMORE '' .....
loved the report, great job guys!
WOW, nice Specks, the chewed Birch is a cool picture...
That guy has a big horseshoe somewhere. Could you ask him if I could borrow it?  Nice Brookies!
What a way to start the year  Bushart
Your cousins fish is a once in a lifetime fish. Simply incredible catch. Looks like a great speck lake you found.  The fish you caught is post worthy on its own! Formidable!

listen this speck was HOOKED man . it smashed the lure so hard that i felt the vibration on my TOES!  my cousin brought it in with ALOT of sifficulties in the way .... if this trout had been barely hooked ... it would have been a goner.....................................  but luckely or skillfully.... it was double hooked right in the solid part in the corner mouth.   BTW whitespinnerbait.... befor TELLING us weather we can keep or not keep a fish.... try catching your own....  then YOU can decide with YOUR own fish what you can do with it.  other than that that speck was a fish of a life time and a FEAST OF A LIFE TIME!  so BUCK UP!

spiel.... finaly someone with a brain.......  please teach me man...  yes my small trout and my cousins trout were missing the back fin on its back...... does this mean there stocked??  if so how can this be??  that lake cant be accessed buy a stocking truck or whatever.....  or am i stupid again.... whats the process with stocking a trout lake.......  some people say that there are splakes in there.......  here is an example.... i caught this beast last year... i thought it was a speck but some guys are telling me that its a splake.....      all i want to know is the truth.....  IS THIS LAKE A NATIVE OR STOCKED????????????????  not that it makes any difference but i might be wrong !!!
looks natural to me...stocked speck lakes in quebec are rare...i do know of a couple and usually one of the bottom fins are clipped
Exactly ............Usually they remove one of the front fins ,,    BTW ...  its a two hour walk into the lake in the middle of nowhere.......
Exactly ............Usually they remove one of the front fins ,,    BTW ...  its a two hour walk into the lake in the middle of nowhere.......

If it's stocked.. it would be done by Helicopter... like all the lakes in the Temagami area are. Some are even done with the Beaver and it's amphib water bomber floats... fish in.. take off and then overfly the lake at 60MPH.. bomb bays open and   trout away............
